main event: A silver spherical object traveling at an unestimated speed was sighted in Greensboro, North Carolina on December 15, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 20 seconds, traveling at an estimated speed of 300 mph.
The object was sighted at 11 o'clock high and the observer lost sight of it after 20 seconds.
There were multiple witness reports of similar unidentified flying objects in the Greensboro and Hartsville, South Carolina areas around this time.
The sightings were considered significant due to the number of witnesses and the inability to identify the objects as any known aircraft.
Potential explanations, such as balloons or other mundane objects, were explored but ultimately ruled out based on the speed, maneuverability, and other characteristics of the observed objects.
